string_data:
Looking at my previous output, I can identify several mistakes in my tagging:

1. I failed to tag the planned protests at airports, banks and Olympic Games as disruption effects
2. I didn't tag the reference to XR's past disruptive actions (shutting down Thames bridges) as disruption effects
3. I missed tagging Gail Bradbrook's quote about their approach as protester messaging
4. The picture caption in the final paragraph doesn't actually describe disruption - it just shows someone being escorted, so shouldn't be in a disruption block

Here is the corrected output:

ID: Daily-Mail_2024-07-06_Greta-Thunberg-is
Source: Daily-Mail
Title: #DS Greta Thunberg is taken away by police as they fire water cannon at demonstrators protesting against fossil fuels in the Netherlands #DE
Content: #DS #PH #CS Greta Thunberg has been taken away by police as they fired a water cannon at demonstrators protesting against fossil fuels in the Netherlands (Alt: The image shows police officers in high-visibility yellow and black uniforms carrying away a person in a bright pink jacket. The scene takes place on a street with brick buildings visible in the background. Additional officers can be seen nearby, and the setting appears to be during a public demonstration or protest event.) #CE
Greta Thunberg has been taken away by police as they fired a water cannon at demonstrators protesting against fossil fuels in the Netherlands.The Swedish climate activist protested alongside members of Extinction Rebellion (XR) as they blocked a busy junction leading onto a motorway in The Hague today.Footage shows Thunberg and others being sprayed with water after police deployed a cannon before removing the group of about 50 demonstrators.The climate group had planned another protest in The Hague for tomorrow, but cancelled it due to the heavy gusts of wind forecast for the morning. #DE #MS XR said in a statement following their blockage: 'The new government's plans are not only disastrous for climate policy, but also in many other areas. Whether it concerns asylum and migration, housing or protecting the rights of marginalised groups.' #ME
#DS #PH #CS Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg (C) is carried away by police as she block the entrance to the A12 with protesters from Extinction Rebellion, in The Hague, on July 6, 2024 (Alt: Police officers in high-visibility jackets are carrying away a protester wearing a bright pink jacket and green beanie on a wet street. The scene shows an environmental demonstration with multiple protesters and police vehicles visible in the background near brick buildings in what appears to be an urban setting.) #CE #DE
#DS Today's protest comes after it was revealed that climate activists in the US and Europe are planning a summer of stunts with demonstrations at airports, banks and the Olympic Games in Paris.But Extinction Rebellion, once notorious for shutting down bridges over the Thames River in London, #DE have shifted their main focus from mass civil disobedience to building an inclusive grassroots movement. #MS Gail Bradbrook, XR's co-founder, told AFP their new-look approach to climate activism strived 'to reach more mainstream folks' and do 'the deeper work of local organising'. #ME But Gabriella Ditton, a spokesperson for the group, said the arrests hadn't deterred them. #MS 'While we face the massive crisis that we are in, we can't stop,' she told AFP. #ME
#PH #CS The climate group had planned another protest in The Hague for tomorrow, but cancelled it due to the heavy gusts of wind forecast for the morning (Alt: The image shows police officers in high-visibility yellow and black uniforms escorting a person in a bright red jacket and green hat. The person appears to be detained, with officers holding their arms on both sides. The scene takes place on a street with brick buildings visible in the background, and there are police vehicles present. Additional officers can be seen in the background.) #CE
